positions.title: Adjunct Professor
positions.description:
Teaching "Money & Banking", "International Trade and Monetary Systems", "Principles of Microeconomics", "Principles of Management", "Principles of Marketing", "Organizational Theory and Behavior", "Consumer Behavior", "Marketing Research", "Marketing Management", "International Marketing Management", "Retail Management and Merchandising", "Advertizing and Promotion Management", "Entrepreneurship and Management of Small Businesses", and "Business in Social Environment (Business Ethics)" at Touro College, Queens, NY - Lander College for Men.
Taught "Fundamentals in Corporate Finance" at New York University.

positions.title: Owner
positions.description:
Turning around, reorganizing, and developing small businesses (mostly 2 to 20 employees), with access to very specific know how on industries and functions via international networks of professionals (as the Institute for Independent Business, offering worldwide contacts to make Small and Medium sized Businesses international players).
Actually working on projects to reinvent book publishing (as printed books) apart from Amazon and e-publishing as profitable and sustainable business.
Teaching "Numeracy 4 Literates" - mainly the probability of all kinds of "evidence" for lawyers (and other people plagued by innumeracy).

positions.title: Chief Executive Principle (Geschäftsführender Gesellschafter)
positions.description: Principal and publisher of three regional daily newspapers in northeast Hungary; conversion of former Eastern European Communist Party newspapers into an integrated publishing trust with new titles (especially shoppers), national advertising sales (representing other regional newspapers as well), web printing (instead of outsourced), household delivery to subscribers and retail sales point network (instead of postal service).

positions.title: Senior Economist
positions.description: The Sachverständigenrat is a completely independent counterpart to the Council of Economic Advisers of the President of the United States. Responsibilities at the SVR were the annual economic forecast as well as "Special Economic Policy Areas" (industrial and regional economic policy, reregulation).
positions.companyName: Sachverständigenrat zur Begutachtung der gesamtwirtschaftlichen Entwicklung

positions.title: Assistant Professor
positions.description: Taught Principals of Microeconomics, Principals of Macroeconomics, and Scientific Literacy in Economics and Business Administration, a self initiated introduction into scientific research and publication writing; Research in Competition Theory and Policy, Econometrics, Economic History, and History of Economic Analysis

volunteerExperiences.description: Special focus of the cooperation was to handle the overstretched span of control a principle and his deputies normally face and which becomes painfully apparent if the school is underperforming. Then the school leadership has no chance to reach and communicate to every teacher effectively if the organizational structure is not handling the loss of immediate reach of the overstretched number of direct relationships between principle and teachers.

allData.headline: Adjunct Professor at Touro College
allData.summary:
Turning around small businesses of all industries by increasing sales and reducing cost (both necessary), and reorganization to free owner's time, taking care of financing along the way as part of an international network of senior executives (Accredited Executive Associate to the Institute for Independent Business).
President & CEO of publishing companies in Hungary, Eastern Germany, and in the Czech Republic after the fall of the iron curtain. Developed a consulting program for industrial and regional economic policy for McKinsey & Comp; Introduced in the late 1980s a nationwide sales information system between shoe retailers and shoe manufacturers in Germany; Former Senior Economist at the German Council of Economic Experts (5 Wise Men), and Assistant Professor in Theory and Policy of Competition.

Specialties: general management, interim and turnaround management, competitive strategy
